org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq

Class FastqFileDataStoreBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq.FastqFileDataStoreBuilder

  • public final class FastqFileDataStoreBuilder
extends Object
    FastqFileDataStoreBuilder is a Builder that can create new instances of FastqDataStores using data from a given input fastq file.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastqFileDataStoreBuilder

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder(File fastqFile)
                          throws IOException
        Create a new instance of FastqFileDataStoreBuilder which will build a FastqDataStore for the given fastq file.

        Since Jillion 5, the file may be any file encoding that is supported by InputStreamSupplier.forFile(File) so files may be compressed.

        Implementation Note:
        As of Jillion 5, this is the same as new FastqFileDataStoreBuilder( InputStreamSupplier.forFile(fastqFile) );
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the fastq file make a FastqDataStore with.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the fastq file does not exist, or can not be read.
        NullPointerException - if fastqFile is null.

      • FastqFileDataStoreBuilder

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder(InputStreamSupplier inputStreamSupplier)
        Create a new instance of FastqFileDataStoreBuilder which will build a FastqDataStore for the given InputStreamSupplier.
        Parameters:
        inputStreamSupplier - the InputStreamSupplier that will return InputStreams of fastq file data to make a FastqDataStore with.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if inputStreamSupplier is null.

      • FastqFileDataStoreBuilder

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder(InputStream inputStream)
                          throws IOException
        Create a new instance of FastqFileDataStoreBuilder which will build a FastqDataStore for the given fastq encoded InputStream. If using this constructor, a FastqQualityCodec must be provided using qualityCodec(FastqQualityCodec) since the inputStream can not be parsed multiple times to determine the qualiy encoding.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the InputStream of the fastq file make a FastqDataStore with.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the fastq file does not exist, or can not be read.
        NullPointerException - if inputstream is null.

      • FastqFileDataStoreBuilder

                          throws IOException
        Create a new instance of FastqFileDataStoreBuilder which will build a FastqDataStore for contents of the given FastqParser.
        Parameters:
        parser - the FastqParser instance to make a FastqDataStore with.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parser is null.
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • qualityCodec

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder qualityCodec(FastqQualityCodec codec)
        Explicitly specify the FastqQualityCodec that is used to encode the quality values in the given fastq file. If the given FastqQualityCodec is not the one used to encode the quality data in the file, then incorrect quality values might silently decode the wrong (possibly higher or lower) quality values or cause an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown during the build() if the incorrectly decoded quality values are not valid phred scores.

        If a quality codec is not given to this builder, then during the actual datastore construction in build(), the codec will be automatically determined by parsing a portion of the file an additional time. This causes extra I/O and increases CPU and execution time to create a new FastqDataStore so it is recommended that the FastqQualityCodec is given if it is known to avoid this performance penalty.

        The quality codec MUST be set if the input fastq data source is an inputStream, since the InputStream may be be able to be fully read twice. Not setting this method with an InputStream source may cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown in build().

        Parameters:
        codec - the FastqQualityCodec to use to parse the file; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if codec is null.

      • hasComments

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder hasComments(boolean hasComments)
        Does this fastq file contain comments on the deflines. If not called, then by default this builder uses hasComments = false.
        Parameters:
        hasComments - do the deflines of the sequences contain comments. If set to true then a more computationally intensive parsing is performed to try to distinguish the id from the comment. Remember some Fastq id's can have spaces which makes comment detection difficult and complex.
        Returns:
        this

      • hasMultilineSequences

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder hasMultilineSequences(boolean multiline)
        Does this fastq file contain records that may have multiple lines for the sequence and qualities sequences. Most fastq files define each record in 4 lines:
        1. The defline
        2. nucleotide sequence
        3. The quality defline
        4. quality sequence
        However, some fastq files split the nucleotide and quality sequences over multiple lines. For performance reasons, checking for multi-lines has been turned off by default and must be explicitly turned on by calling this method.
        Parameters:
        multiline - true if this file may contain multilines; false otherwise (defaults to false.
        Returns:
        this

      • filter

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder filter(Predicate<String> filter)
        Only include the FastqRecords which pass the given Predicate for the ID. If a filter is not given to this builder, then all records in the fastq file will be included in the built FastqDataStore.

        If both this method and filter(Predicate) are used, then the ID filter is applied first and then any remaining records are filtered with this filter.

        If this method is called multiple times, then the previous filters are overwritten and only the last filter is used.

        API Note:
        This is different than filterRecords(Predicate) because the latter needs to parse the entire record before filtering can be determined while this filter only needs the ID. If you are only filtering by ID, use this method which may have better performance since the nucleotide and quality values don't have to be parsed on reads that aren't accepted by the id filter.
        Parameters:
        filter - a Predicate instance that can be used to filter out specified fastq records BY ID; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if filter is null.
        See Also:
        filterRecords(Predicate)

      • filterRecords

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder filterRecords(Predicate<FastqRecord> filter)
        Only include the FastqRecords which pass the given Predicate. If no predicates are given to this builder, then all records in the fastq file will be included in the built FastqDataStore.

        If both this method and filter(Predicate) to filter by ID are used, then the ID filter is applied first and then any remaining records are filtered with this filter.

        If this method is called multiple times, then the previous filters are overwritten and only the last filter is used.

        API Note:
        This is different than filter(Predicate) because the latter can only filter by ID. If you are only filtering by ID, use filter(Predicate) which may have better performance since the nucleotide and quality values don't have to be parsed on reads that aren't accepted by the id filter.

        Also, we had to keep the old filter method to maintain compatibility with old versions of Jillion

        Parameters:
        filter - a Predicate instance that can be used to filter out specified fastq records; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if filter is null.
        Since:
        5.0
        See Also:
        filter(Predicate)

      • hint

        public FastqFileDataStoreBuilder hint(DataStoreProviderHint hint)
        Provide a DataStoreProviderHint to this builder to let it know the implementation preferences of the client. If no hint is given, then this builder will try to store all the fastq records in memory which may cause an Exception if there isn't enough memory. The DataStoreProviderHint is just a guideline and may be ignored by this builder when determining which FastqDataStore implementation to chose to build in build().
        Parameters:
        hint - an instance of DataStoreProviderHint; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if hint is null.
        See Also:
        DataStoreProviderHint

      • build

        public FastqFileDataStore build()
                         throws IOException
        Parse the given fastq file and return a new instance of a FastqDataStore using all the input parameters given so far. If not all optional parameters are set then default values will be used:
        • If no FastqQualityCodec has been specified by qualityCodec(FastqQualityCodec), then it will be auto-detected for a performance penalty.
        • If no filter has been specified by filter(Predicate) or filterRecords(Predicate), then all FastqRecords will be included in this FastqDataStore.
        • If no DataStoreProviderHint has been specified by hint(DataStoreProviderHint), then this builder will try to store all the FastqRecords that meet the DataStoreFilter requirements in memory. This may cause out of memory errors if there is not enough memory available.
        Returns:
        a new FastqFileDataStore instance; never null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem parsing the fastq file.
        IllegalStateException - if quality codec is not set and input fastq data source is an inputStream which might prevent us from parsing the data twice (once to determine codec, the other to actual decode the data).
        IllegalArgumentException - if the quality values are not valid for the specified FastqQualityCodec (can be thrown even if the quality codec is auto-detected).
        See Also:
        qualityCodec(FastqQualityCodec), hint(DataStoreProviderHint), filter(Predicate), filterRecords(Predicate)
